## Mulitparticipant Screen Sharing
In SAGE multiple people can share screen at the same time. To share the screen, navigate to any blank space, right click, select "Screenshares", and click "Start Sharing"

![](images/screensharing.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

Next, select the screen you want to share and click share.
![](images/screensharing2.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

## Following a User

In SAGE, you can follow pointer of a specific user. To do this:

- Right click on the screen, and select "Users"
![](images/users.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}
- Click the name of the user you want to follow, and select, "Follow Them". Similarly to unfollow, click "Unfollow them".

![](images/following.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

## Using pens and erasers

To use a pen, right click on any blank space, and select "Annotations". You can write both on the screen and on the pdf.
![](images/write.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}
To erase, right click on any blank space, and select "Eraser". To erase click on the writings.
![](images/erase.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}

## Python 3 Kernels

Python 3 kernels are directly incorporated into SAGE (however, other applications like R, and Stata are not available). To create a kernel:

- Right click on a blank space on the screen, select kernels and click "Create Kernel".
![](images/kernel1.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}
- Type the name of the kernel (spaces are not allowed). Then, click "Create".
![](images/kernel2.png){fig-align="center" width="800px"}
